intro: Diplotaxis subcuneata, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads that resemble dandelion fluff. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Diplotaxis subcuneata is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
